creator: svasan@successfactors.com
text:
In Jboss there is an command line parameter using which you can specify the IPAddress to which a particular instance can be bind to.

It would be nice to have similar feature in the tomcat also.  Currently we have to modify the conf/server.xml file for the same.

Similarly if the port to which a particular tomcat instance listen to, made a command line parameter, that also would be good.

In short instead of modifying the conf/server.xml, attributes relates to a particular instance should be made as command line parameters so that any modifications to them are not intrusive.
Use ${...} property replacement and specify the properties on the command line.
creator: markt@apache.org
svasan@successfactors.com
text:
Should the parameters be passed like below?

startup.bat ${port}=8080, ${ip_address}=127.0.0.1.
